intro: Daemonorops longispinosa, commonly known as the long-spined palm, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by dark blue, edible fruits. Its leaves are long and have spiny margins, which give it its common name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to humid, shaded environments.
